questions.question: Which of these lifecycle methodologies is least suitable for use on a safety-critical system?
choices: Incremental development
Spiral model
Waterfall lifecycle
answers: Evolutionary prototyping

questions.question: Which of the following things is most important if you want to create quality software?
choices: Lots of money
A good requirements specification
The best software tools
answers: Properly trained people

questions.question: What is the optimum number of people on which to evaluate the usability of an interface?
Which of the following is NOT true when building user interface prototypes?
choices: You need to do evaluation on typical users to get sensible results
You can get useful results from a paper-based user interface
Putting realistic data in your prototype screens gives more useful results
answers: You need to make your prototype work for every possible data input

questions.question: Select the most sensible order in which to build a system:
choices: Requirements, design, maintenance, implementation, testing.
Design, requirements, implementation, testing, maintenance.
Requirements, design, implementation, maintenance, testing.
answers: Requirements, design, implementation, testing, maintenance.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is NOT true about Extreme Programming:
choices: It is flexible and responsive to changing user needs.
It is an example of an agile programming methodology.
Unit testing is a key discipline in Extreme Programming.
answers: It includes producing a requirements specification to define what will be produced.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true?
choices: You can always develop software faster by adding extra programming effort.
A project plan should not be changed once it has been made.
A company should always charge the same amount of money to clients for a day of programmer time.
answers: Time, cost, scope and quality of software are related.

questions.question: Which of the following types of maintenance involves adding extra functionality to your software?
choices: Corrective maintenance.
Adaptive maintenance.
Preventative maintenance.
answers: Perfective maintenance.

questions.question: Which of the following requirements is a functional requirement?
choices: The system should be developed in line with company quality standards.
The system should meet international nuclear power safety standards.
The system should work quickly on Unix computers.
answers: When the user presses the START button, the vehicle should move forward at 2 m/s.

questions.question: Which of the following requirements is an external requirement?
choices: When the user presses the START button, the vehicle should move forward at 2 m/s.
The system should be developed in line with company quality standards.
The system should work quickly on Unix computers.
answers: The system should meet international nuclear power safety standards.

questions.question: Which of the following requirements is not testable?
choices: When the user presses the START button, the vehicle should move forward at 2 m/s.
The system should be developed in line with company quality standards.
The system should meet international nuclear power safety standards.
answers: The system should work quickly on Unix computers.

questions.question: Which of the following requirements is a process requirement?
choices: When the user presses the START button, the vehicle should move forward at 2 m/s.
The system should meet international nuclear power safety standards.
The system should work quickly on Unix computers.
answers: The system should be developed in line with company quality standards.

questions.question: What is the relationship between ISO 9001 and ISO 9000-3?
choices: ISO 9001 is a more detailed version of ISO 9000-3 specifically for software.
ISO 9001 is a more recent version of ISO 9000-3.
ISO 9000-3 is a more recent version of ISO 9001.
answers: ISO 9000-3 is a more detailed of ISO 9001 specifically for software.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a type of testing?
choices: White box testing
Stress testing
Regression testing
answers: Affective testing

questions.question: Which of the following was not a conclusion of the enquiry into the London Ambulance Service Computer-Aided Despatch Service?
choices: London Ambulance Service needs full-time IT managers.
Around 4 years would be needed to build complete system.
Computer-aided despatch is desirable and should be implemented.
answers: Computer-aided despatch is dangerous and should be avoided.

questions.question: What is the most valuable thing that you can do if your company wants to improve its software processes?
choices: Measure what is done, in order to observe where the problems are.
Improve the way the company system tests its software.
Introduce unit testing to the company.
answers: Put in place a full quality control system to ISO-standards.

questions.question: Which of the following should encourage you to refactor your software?
choices: Complaints from your customers.
An increase in the number of bugs reported.
Bad crashes in your run times.
answers: Bad smells in your code.

questions.question: What does a sequence diagram show about the way your program works?
choices: The methods that one class calls in another class
The structure of a class
How the hard parts of your code can be written
answers: How a main operation of the program works by calling different classes/methods

questions.question: In the Software Engineering Institute's Capability Maturity Model, which level describes an organization that is constantly attempting to improve its performance?
choices: Level 1
Level 3
Level 7
answers: Level 5

questions.question: Which of the following is best as a definition of software engineering
choices: Software engineering is about making bug-free software
Software engineering is about always making the best software we can
Software engineering is about carrying out lots of quality procedures to make your customers happy
answers: Software engineering is about consistently making software of a level of quality appropriate to its use

questions.question: Why are documented procedures and management necessary in order to produce quality software?
choices: Because software developers need to be kept in line or they do the wrong thing
Because it makes management happy that they are in charge
Because the ISO standard says so
answers: Because software development is complex and there are many things that need to be remembered

questions.question: Which of the following is not a good reason for holding a code review in your development team?
choices: In order to share good programming practice among the team
In order to identify potential problems in code before it is deployed
In order to give the team a better understanding of the coding standards used
answers: In order to identify the best and worst programmers in your team

questions.question: Which kind of testing is done by the customer of the software rather than the developer?
choices: Integration testing
Unit testing
System testing
answers: Acceptance testing

questions.question: Which of the following statements is not true?
choices: UML stands for Unified Modelling Language.
Component Diagrams are part of UML.
Sequence Diagrams are part of UML.
answers: UML is a process for modelling systems.

questions.question: On a project which has been running for two years and is behind schedule for delivery in six months time, which of the following strategies is most likely to make things worse?
choices: Adding extra staff to the project to increase the effort available
Reducing the functionality that will be delivered at the due date
Identifying outside expertise that can help with specific problems
answers: Revise the plan to give a later delivery date

questions.question: Which of the following is best as a definition of software engineering
choices: Software engineering is about making bug-free software
Software engineering is about always making the best software we can
Software engineering is about carrying out lots of quality procedures to make your customers happy
answers: Software engineering is about consistently making software of a level of quality appropriate to its use

questions.question: Which of these aspects of software development is NOT included in requirements analysis?
choices: Deciding the functions of the software
Exploring what legislation might apply to development of the software
Planning what development process will be used to make the software
answers: Buying machines to run the software on

questions.question: What is the key insight of the Spiral Model for software engineering?
choices: The idea that reducing risk is important
The concept of going around in circles
The emphasis on programming as a central discipline without which nothing is achieved
The knowledge that carrying out a project in phases is a good thing
answers: The idea that reducing risk is important

questions.question: Which of these is NOT one of the core disciplines in Extreme Programming
choices: Continuous planning
Pair programming
Group code walkthroughs
Refactoring

questions.question: Which of the following would be described as corrective maintenance of software?
choices: Adding a new feature to the software
Fixing a mathematical calculation which sometimes makes the software crash
Updating the software because a change to the operating system is causing problems
Refactoring a class to make the software more understandable

questions.question: Which of the following would be described as adaptive maintenance of software?
choices: Adding a new feature to the software
Fixing a mathematical calculation which sometimes makes the software crash
Updating the software because a change to the operating system is causing problems
Refactoring a class to make the software more understandable

questions.question: Which of the following would be described as perfective maintenance of software?
choices: Adding a new feature to the software
Fixing a mathematical calculation which sometimes makes the software crash
Updating the software because a change to the operating system is causing problems
Refactoring a class to make the software more understandable

questions.question: Which of the following would be described as preventative maintenance of software?
choices: Adding a new feature to the software
Fixing a mathematical calculation which sometimes makes the software crash
Updating the software because a change to the operating system is causing problems
Refactoring a class to make the software more understandable

questions.question: Which of the following should encourage you to refactor your software?
choices: Complaints from your customers
An increase in the number of bugs reported
Bad crashes in your run times
Bad smells in your code

questions.question: Which of the following requirements is a functional requirement?
choices: Unit tests should be written for all classes in the system
The system should be user friendly
The system should sound an alarm if furnace temperature exceeds 450°C
The hardware needed to run the system should cost less than £400 per unit

questions.question: Which of the following requirements is an external requirement?
choices: Unit tests should be written for all classes in the system
The system should be user friendly
The system should sound an alarm if furnace temperature exceeds 450°C
The hardware needed to run the system should cost less than £400 per unit

questions.question: Which of the following requirements is not testable?
choices: Unit tests should be written for all classes in the system
The system should be user friendly
The system should sound an alarm if furnace temperature exceeds 450°C
The hardware needed to run the system should cost less than £400 per unit

questions.question: Which of the following requirements is a process requirement?
choices: Unit tests should be written for all classes in the system
The system should be user friendly
The system should sound an alarm if furnace temperature exceeds 450°C
The hardware needed to run the system should cost less than £400 per unit

questions.question: In the Software Engineering Institute's Capability Maturity Model, which level was the minimum specified for being able to bid for US Department of Defence contracts?
choices: Level 1
Level 3
Level 5
Level 7

questions.question: What does the UML component diagram show about the way your program works?
choices: The methods that one class calls in another class
The structure of a class
How a main operation of the program works by calling different classes/methods
How the hard parts of your code can be written

questions.question: Why are documented procedures and management necessary in order to produce quality software?
choices: Because managers like to show the programmers that they are in charge
Because the Capability Maturity Model says so
Because software development is complex and there are many things that need to be remembered
Because the ISO standard says so

questions.question: Which of the following is not a good reason for holding a code review with your development team?
choices: In order to identify the best and worst programmers in your team
In order to share good programming practice among the team
In order to identify potential problems in code before it is deployed
In order to give the team a better understanding of the coding standards used

questions.question: Which of the following is not a good idea when designing a user interface?
choices: Make the task to be accomplished as clear as possible
Use white space on the screen to help the user understand what things are related
Keep user scenarios in mind when deciding what information is needed
Keep error messages short to save as much space as possible

questions.question: Which of the following is not a git command
choices: commit
embrace
pull
merge

questions.question: Which of the following is a correct statement?
choices: We test programs because it shows that our programs work properly
TDD stands for Test-Discover-Debug
Testing is the most effective way of finding bugs in programs
Testing gives repeatable checking at low cost that specific problems do not occur

questions.question: What should you do when the user of your software makes a wrong input?
choices: Give them the clearest indication where the error is and how to fix it
Keep messages short and sharp - they don't read them anyway
Tell the user off so that they will not make the same mistake again
Refuse to take any more input from them

questions.question: What should you do if you have 50 screens of information in your interface for the user to choose from?
choices: Put them all on the screen at once in tabbed screens
Make a long alphabetical list for the user to scroll through to pick one
Group them into related areas, and only give more detailed choices when the user has chosen an area
Make a long list ordered by frequency of use for the user to scroll through and pick one

questions.question: Which of the following international standards applies to the development of software?
choices: ISO 4007
ISO 8003

questions.question: Which of the following would you be unlikely to see in a Project Plan?
choices: The organisation of the project
An analysis of the risks associated with the project
The design of the software for the project
The schedule for developing the software

questions.question: For the following set of tasks, time needed per task, and dependencies between tasks, what is the elapsed time needed for the critical path? Task Time Needed Dependencies
Which of these lifecycle methodologies is best described as a rigid development methodology with fixed stages that are addressed in a specific order?
choices: Incremental development
Evolutionary prototyping
Waterfall lifecycle
Spiral model

questions.question: What is the main message of Brooks' "No silver bullet" paper?
choices: Software development needs better languages
Software development needs better trained people
If a software project takes one person nine months, it does not mean nine people could do it in one month
No single improvement to what we do can deliver quality software

questions.question: Which of these is the least efficient way to evaluate the usability of a new interface?
choices: Make an animated set of computer screens, linked by buttons that steer you from screen to screen
Implement the actual software and try it on users
Make a set of hand drawn sketches of the screens to show the users
Use Photoshop to make drawings of what the screens will look like

questions.question: Which of the following is true when evaluating a design for a user interface?
choices: You need to test your interface on at least 100 typical users to get sensible results
You cannot get useful results from a paper-based user interface prototype
Putting realistic data in your prototype screens gives more useful results
You need to make your prototype work for every possible data input

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true?
choices: You can always develop software faster by adding extra programming effort
Time, cost, scope and quality of software are related
A project plan should not be changed once it has been made
A company should always charge the same amount of money to clients for a day of programmer time

questions.question: Which category of maintenance would include refactoring software so that it is easier to maintain?
choices: Corrective maintenance.
Adaptive maintenance.
Perfective maintenance.
Preventative maintenance

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true?
choices: Black box testing is based on the requirements specification
White box testing is based on the requirements specification
Testing is more effective than code reviews for finding errors
Regression testing entails testing all the paths through the code

questions.question: Which of the following requirements is not testable?
choices: The system should work quickly
The system should be developed in Java
The system should store all information typed by the user
The system should use the existing software library to turn the heating on and off

questions.question: Which of the following requirements is a process requirement?
choices: The system should work quickly
The system should be developed in Java
The system should store all information typed by the user
The system should use the existing software library to turn the heating on and off

questions.question: Which of the following requirements is a functional requirement?
choices: The system should work quickly
The system should be developed in Java
The system should store all information typed by the user
The system should use the existing software library to turn the heating on and off

questions.question: Which of the following requirements is an external requirement?
choices: The system should work quickly
The system should be developed in Java
The system should store all information typed by the user
The system should use the existing software library to turn the heating on and off

questions.question: Which of the following things is most important if you want to create quality software

The best software tools
A good requirements specification
Lots of money

choices: ISO 4007

In order to share good programming practice among the team
In order to identify potential problems in code before it is deployed
In order to give the team a better understanding of the coding standards used

choices: Complaints from your customers
An increase in the number of bugs reported
Bad crashes in your run times
Bad smells in your code

questions.question: What is the most valuable thing that you can do if your company wants to improve its software processes?
choices: Measure what is done, in order to observe where the problems are
Put in place a full quality control system to ISO-standards
Improve the way the company system tests its software
Introduce unit testing to the company

questions.question: Which kind of UML diagram illustrates how the main operations of a program are carried out through calls to methods in different classes?
choices: Class diagram
Component diagram
Component diagram
Use case diagram

questions.question: Which kind of UML diagram shows which methods in each class are called by other classes, and which classes they are called by?
choices: Class diagram
Component diagram
Sequence diagram
Use case diagram

questions.question: Which kind of UML diagram shows how actors interact with a system to achieve goals?
choices: Class diagram
Component diagram
Sequence diagram
Use case diagram

questions.question: Which of the following statements is not true?
choices: UML stands for Unified Modelling Language
UML is a process for modelling systems
Project planning diagrams are part of UML
Class diagrams are part of UML

questions.question: In the Software Engineering Institute's Capability Maturity Model, what term is used to describe an organisation with a stable process model meeting the demands of the US Department of Defense?
choices: Repeatable
Defined
Managed
Optimizing

questions.question: Which of the following is a correct statement?
choices: We test programs because it shows that our programs work properly
TDD stands for Test-Discover-Debug
Testing is the most effective way of finding bugs in programs
Testing gives repeatable checking at low cost that specific problems do not occur

questions.question: Which of the following is a correct statement?
choices: Ethics involves doing a cost/benefit analysis
Ethics is about making choices with a moral dimension
Ethics means we should not work for the defence industry
Ethics means that we need to obey the law

questions.question: Which of the following was not a conclusion of the enquiry into the London Ambulance Service Computer-Aided Despatch Service?
choices: London Ambulance Service needs full-time IT managers
Around 4 years would be needed to build complete system
Computer-aided despatch is desirable and should be implemented
Computer-aided despatch is dangerous and should be avoided

questions.question: Which of the following statements is not true?
choices: If you use source control then you don't have to worry about a disc failure
Source control is including in many Interactive Development Environments
Source control strategy is part of the quality plan for a project
Source control is an important part of developing engineered software
